>> But Cedric, what happens when a subclass of SubClass needs to
>> do even=
 more in its setUp()?
> 
> Right, this is only a stop-gap measure, but it's=
 one step
> better than the current situation.

No, it's *exactly* the situ=
ation in Junit <4, as J.B. already showed.

> - Provide a template method: =
 setUp() / onSetUp() and
> tearDown() / onTearDown().  A bit better but sti=
ll won't work
> very well for classes that extend TestCase more than two le=
vels deep.

That's what Junit does, plus providing an empty default impleme=
ntation for
the method to implement, so that you don't have to implement it=
 if you don't
need to provide any code.

> - Let users annotate these metho=
ds instead of relying on
> their names.  This is the best solution and it s=
olves all the
> problems (and the reason why I chose it for TestNG).

As yo=
u might already know, that wasn't an available option when Junit was
origin=
ally written, and is exactly what is done in Junit 4.

Cheers, Ilja
